preprocessing_steps: Filter observations where observation_date is in March 2024 (already all in March)

Identify observations containing haste indicators: in a hurry, hastily, hurriedly, quickly, rushed, in a rush, hurry, hurried, left, moved, ran, skipped, forgot, ignored, bypassed, shortcut, took shortcut

Classify haste-related observations into safety risk categories: tripping hazard, slippery surface, emergency exit obstruction, inadequate safety equipment, chemical exposure risk, electrical hazard, fire hazard, equipment hazard, procedural hazard
Count observations per safety risk category
rationale: A horizontal bar chart is ideal for comparing categorical frequencies, especially when the categories have long names. It clearly shows the most common safety risks associated with haste in the observations for March 2024, making it easy to identify the most prevalent risk type.

suggestions.filtering: Filtered to 38 observations all dated in March 2024

alternatives.rationale: A pie chart shows proportions clearly, but may not be ideal if there are many categories.
A treemap can show hierarchical data, but for flat categories, it might be overkill.
